name: Oxford Abingdon Four Pillars Hotel

reviews.text: A colleague and I were booked in here. First impression wasn't great, but once inside this changed.
reviews.title: Better than it looked, apart from breakfast.

reviews.text: Good rooms, good bar, with real ale. Easy walk into town.
reviews.title: A very comfortable stay.

reviews.text: Free wifi.
reviews.title: Unlucky?

reviews.text: Could not ask for more, apart from breakfast.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: We both asked for poached eggs, mine were overdone but still soft. My colleagues were solid blobs. How the cook could sent them out was beyond us, as you could see they were in edible.
reviews.title: Handy for Tesco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a Sunday night but as we went out almost as soon as we arrived and returned after midnight can't comment much except to say room was good, clean, quiet and bed was comfortable. Very few guests staying so inconclusive. Breakfast perfectly acceptable with good coffee.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently had my wedding here and I couldn't fault a thing. The staff were all helpful, friendly and hard working. Kerry (the Wedding Planner) was very accomodating and organised everything perfectly. The food was tasty and filling, the rooms were clean, spacious and very comfortable. Everyone had a wonderful time and no complaints (unheard of at any wedding I've known), well done!
reviews.title: A fantastic stay and excellent wedding
Brilliant!
reviews.text: My daughter's wedding was held at the hotel on Sunday 26 August. Everything that the hotel did was perfectly executed by Kerry (their Wedding Planner) and her staff. They were polite, friendly and speedy in their work all day. The whole event went without a hitch due to Kerry and her team - I highly recommend them. Nothing was too much trouble for Kerry, she is excellent.
The hotel rooms and breakfast etc were very acceptable and of good quality. I would definitely give the hotel 5 Stars for Value For Money and the quality of their staff.
reviews.title: good nights sleep

reviews.text: Nice hotel, the waiter was lovely and helpful. and got me fresh milk for my room Room was big and clean. Bit fiddly getting into the room but Housekeeping were great. Good car parking. Would stay again. if in the area. Breakfast was nice, could have been a little hotter but it was still ok.
reviews.title: OK and will probably stay again.

reviews.text: Very clean hotel
reviews.title: four day break

reviews.text: the food was excellent and there was plenty of choice. the lemon posset was to die for, could have eaten it every night.
reviews.title: A friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was until ten oclock so there was no need to get up early.
reviews.title: oxford short break
Good for getting to Oxford
reviews.text: the room was spacious and very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Heavy doors Lol :-(

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here to meet up with two friends. The bar and reception area downstairs are very pleasant areas to relax in. My only grumble was the price of drinks, which meant that we left the hotel to have more drinks and they lost further business from us. The room was very well equipped, all the toiletries etc that you would need for a short break. The room was very clean and tidy. There are some things that could be improved to make the room more pleasant for example the bathroom door is in need of replacing, but nothing that would stop us staying here again. We did not hear the noise from the road at all and had a very good nights sleep. The breakfast was fantastic and there was a lot of choice. The service from all the staff was outstanding. The best thing about this hotel was the price and the outstanding value, thanks for a great stay.
reviews.title: Just what we needed.

reviews.text: Hotel is only 3 star but the staff at this hotel are certainly 5 star - so welcoming, so friendly and nothing too much trouble. Immediately made welcome from the moment I checked in. When I couldn't make the heating work properly someone appeared as soon as I put the phone down. Room was clean and adequate though could do with some redecoration. Meals good value for money and a well cooked english breakfast. Great for travelling en route to Oxford and surrounding areas on overnight stay.
reviews.title: A home from home feeling

reviews.text: It was rather difficult to find the hotel at first sight; located in an industrial area this is rather not a quite place (traffic all around the hotel). Breakfast opens at 7.00am only and staff is strictly not flexible on this; check-out last more than 20mn as only one staff was in charge and did not want to receive support from other staff members on duty in the hotel; overall lack of friendliness & professionalism from hotel staff before departure (breakfast & check-out)
reviews.title: Poor Service for a 3* hotel

reviews.text: Room was rather clean, spacious & well equipped
reviews.title: A good motel

reviews.text: I won't recommend it for business stays!
reviews.title: Good Nights Sleep

description: Newly refurbished bar and lounge area featuring a wall mounted TV to keep up to date on all the latest sport and news, an open plan restaurant and quiet seating areas.
